title: Do you think Nikola Tesla could have succeeded at providing free energy to the world? - Quora

response.answer_text: First, it wasn’t Tesla’s intent to provide free energy. If I recall, the Serbian film “Secret of Nikola Tesla” was the only one making that claim. In articles/interviews, Tesla mused about selling “horsepower” from Niagara Falls” to a sugar-factory in Australia, in the form of un-tappable secure-comms signals. As Tesla said, they would phone in their order, and his company would send the kilowatts to that factory. There were megabucks to be made! He expected to attract all the tycoons! (If anything was going to be done for free, it would only be some unsecured transmissions to drive all the tiny clock-motors, worldwide.) Second, solar panels now exist, so we already have “free energy.” And if you have a creek on your land, and a dam with enough head, you have “free energy.” That was actually Tesla’s version: install broadcast-power on every inaccessible high-mountain waterfall, all transmitting into the global system. No coal turbines needed! Hydro power would become cheap! Unfortunately, investors decided that it was a delusional 1905 super-science fantasy. Instead, the US govt, (inspired by the harnessing of Niagara Falls,) started those giant dam projects, impossibly huge volumes of concrete, to create many “Niagara Falls” -type cliffsides all around the country. (Heh, a delusional 1930s super-science fantasy, with the tax money flowing into approved govt. contractors, rather than into the pockets of 1905 robber-barons.) Third, does Tesla’s broadcast-power system actually work? Well, all the sneering objections have been defeated: It’s against known science, since we know that radio waves travel only in straight lines, and cannot bend around the Earth! (Wrong, as Marconi finally proved: it doesn’t apply to ground-waves deep in VLF wavelengths.)It’s against known science, since radio obeys inverse-square! (Wrong, it certainly doesn’t work for two-dimensional systems, and standing waves trapped in a cavity don’t obey inverse-square, they obey Cosine fall-off.)the Earth, electrically, is like a vast ocean! (Wrong, not for VLF radio, where the Earth electrically is like a small metal ball inside a larger hollow ball.)the Earth has no standing-waves! (Wrong, finally re-discovered in the 1950s, they’re now called Schumann resonances.)We can’t send energy through the ground! (Wrong, since Tesla wasn’t sending any energy through the ground …instead he was sending currents through the ground. The physics was just like any AM radio tower, or any power line. Tesla insisted that his system wasn’t really broadcast, instead it was a conductor (where all the currents are inside the metal, but the all of the flowing energy is entirely in the fields, outside the wire.))It’s still against known radio theory! (WRONG, but this error was only discovered recently, late 1990s, where contemporary researchers found that the old 1936 “Seneca Lake experiment,” the one which disproved Zenneck surface-waves …was apparently done incorrectly. Corums’ replication (performed at the actual Seneca Lake) instead supported the competing Zenneck surface-wave theory, rather than the long-trusted Norton surface-wave theory. Tesla’s broadcast power relied on the surface-wave phenomenon predicted by Zenneck’s math. The disproof of Tesla …was itself disproved.)If you build this thing, it simply won’t work! (POSSIBLY wrong, since a tiny transmitter cannot slightly approach the operating-threshold of Tesla’s system. To test the concept at all, we’d need something the size of Tesla’s Colorado Springs system. Megabucks are required. Tesla’s supporters (the non-billionaire hobbyist community) cannot afford to build a small prototype power plant.)But Tesla was a known crackpot! (Well, so was Linus Pauling with his silly vitamin-C stuff (so, we must take away his Nobel prize! Clearly his earlier work had to be crackpot too!!) Um no, that’s not how it works. Tesla’s mental decline in the mid 1930s doesn’t affect his 1899 discoveries. Instead, a better analogy is the Wright Brothers, widely called the “lying brothers” or “the Wrong brothers,” because they claimed to be piloting real airplanes for nearly a year in Dayton, OH. Everybody knew this wasn’t happening, because if it was, then the local Dayton newspapers would be covering it! (Those local reporters refused to even look. Since they knew that flying machines were just crackpot ideas. ONLY a beekeeping newsletter carried the story.) The disgusted Wrights gave up on the USA, and took their “show” overseas to France, making world headlines overnight.)This last one was a typical self-fulfilling prophecy. The same self-fulfilling prophecy may have stopped Tesla: his radio claims were widely disbelieved, hence no investors appeared other than JP Morgan, hence, no completed Wardenclyffe radio station, and no broadcasting demonstration …thus “proving” that Tesla had to be wrong! But with Marconi, he came from a wealthy family in Italy, and obtained backing from rich family friends. So any staunch and universal disbelief from the investors out in the greater world …couldn’t block Marconi from completing his massive Poldhu VHF antenna tower, which was a direct analogy for (and a ddirect competition with) Tesla’s Wardenclyffe tower. (And apparently Poldhu contained an enormous double-resonant transformer, or “Tesla coil,” rather than Marconi’s patented single-resonator “whip-crack” transmitter.)  Tesla’s giant antenna-tower at Wardenclyffe:  . Marconi’s ocean-spanning transmitter below:  Note that, according to contemporary EM physics, Tesla’s tower (above) would have been capable of far higher output-wattage than Marconi’s. And, if it was locked onto one of the planetary VLF resonance modes, it may well have been capable of creating immense VLF standing waves worldwide, and even some “broadcast power.” But even without such standing waves, whenever we broadcast some basic VLF signals via electrically-short vertical dipole antennas (in order to output some kilowatts,) then the output-voltage MUST be immense. In other words, for VLF transmissions, a huge air-core step-up transformer is required, even in Marconi’s system. And if we double the voltage, we increase the emission-wattage by a factor of 4X. Marconi had to use Tesla coils to broadcast across the Atlantic. There was no getting around it. But even then, Marconi’s maximum output-voltage would be limited by corona discharge from the “sharp” portions of his array, from antenna-wire tips. Tesla’s version was designed to withstand 100x higher voltage, tens of megavolts, perhaps hundreds, producing tens of thousands of times higher wattage than Marconi’s own VLF broadcasts. But Tesla ran out of funds, so his tower’s smooth round metal surface was never installed, and also he couldn’t employ any staff of engineers to complete even some low-wattage broadcasts. The “sharp” girder-network of Tesla’s upper terminal would provoke unwanted discharges, occurring at far below his intended operating voltage. When operated at night, in this incomplete state, apparently Wardenclyffe tower generated gigantic lightnings visible for miles. (Like Marconi’s system, it was designed to send out emissions today called “VLF groundwaves,” with RF currents in the earth (just as Tesla claimed,) and EM fields in the space just above.) Any lightning bolts (rf arcs) are a known failure-mechanism in high-power radio transmitters! Yet Tesla’s system might well have been able to communicate with Europe, even when incomplete. But by that time Tesla didn’t have a dime, and his staff was long gone, so the simplest experiments were impossible. Soon Westinghouse Corp came in and removed all the big steam turbines and dynamos which either had been on temporary loan, or where the flow of payments from Tesla had dried up. .

It is true that our western civilization runs on money and control, not freedom. From the little that I can know of Nikola Tesla, his inspiration was focused on doing what was good for the whole. He was not the average greedy and selfish person of his time. It is interesting to notice the need to put monetary value on everything today. The immense and diverse energy within water is freely available to everyone, and yet the educated and elite people will find ways of putting a monetary value on it and then giving technical explanations why it is necessary to do so. At least with water and air we can all tap into the abundant supply without any technology. I am sure there are sources of electrical energy available that could be tapped into with the right geometry and maybe a small input charge to coagulate and accumulate voltage. The limits that we have established by the laws of science are useful for working and innovating the current systems, but their is gross inefficiencies that cannot be overcome because of the laws blocking possibilities. Natures use of electricity and the energies in Light are far more efficient and free. 1901 was a pivotal year in which the negative consciousness of a few very wealthy people set the agenda for negative scientific development throughout the Twentieth century. An occasional voice was heard disputing scientific claims, but they were quickly censored. There are a few more around today, but the mass of those who know are quick to call them “cranks” and “crackpots”. In some ways, Earth human beings are their own worst enemy because they allow their arrogance to overrule their feeling-tones of unconditional love and respect for others. When humans have self respect and work together, the outcome far exceeds the sum of the parts. This is a universal law that also would apply to electrics and magnetics if we opened our hearts to it.

The laws of physics and the nature of wave transmission (which is what Tesla’s transmission system was) guarantee that over 99.9% of the energy emitted is wasted. A large portion just going off into space. Another large portion directly to the ground and only the tiny bits absorbed by receiving stations getting put to useful work (after the appx 20% loss in conversion back to a useful form) The system Tesla wanted to set up would have led to greater than 1000 times as much pollution for the same amount of energy use by homes and factories.We could not possibly have developed our societies to the current technological levels under these conditions.

No. While he made some great inventions that continue to benefit mankind, many of his later ideas were just nonsense. His early successes motivated him to try to follow up with more of the same, but eventually his ability to invent fantastic stuff didn’t match up to his self marketing. Humanity today knows everything that Tesla and the rest of humanity knew at his time, and lots more. If there was a way to “provide free energy,” someone else would have built it by now and be benefiting from it.

Do you think Nikola Tesla could have succeeded at providing free energy to the world? No. There is no such thing as “free energy”. There is cheap energy and there is fully paid-off renewable energy but there isn’t “free energy”. Tesla was working on a wireless transmission system which had diesel generators supplying the electricity and that does not add up to “free energy”.
Do you think Nikola Tesla could have succeeded at providing free energy to the world? No. Tesla was a supreme electrical engineer for his time. But he sucked at theory.
